4546  double tx = p2x2 - p2x1;
4547  double ty = p2y2 - p2y1;
4548 
4549  // check that the segments have a length
4550  if ((fabs(sx) > ALMOST_ZERO || fabs(sy) > ALMOST_ZERO) && (fabs(tx) > ALMOST_ZERO || fabs(ty) > ALMOST_ZERO))
4551  {
4552  std::pair<double, double> p = CLLayoutRenderer::calculate_intersection_point_2d(p1x1, p1y1, sx, sy, p2x1, p2y1, tx, ty);
4553 
4554  // check for NaN results -> no intersection
4555  if (p.first == p.first && p.second == p.second)
4556  {
4557  double max_x1 = (p1x1 > p1x2) ? p1x1 : p1x2;
4558  double max_x2 = (p2x1 > p2x2) ? p2x1 : p2x2;
4559  double max_y1 = (p1y1 > p1y2) ? p1y1 : p1y2;
4560  double max_y2 = (p2y1 > p2y2) ? p2y1 : p2y2;
4561 
4562  double min_x1 = (p1x1 <= p1x2) ? p1x1 : p1x2;
4563  double min_x2 = (p2x1 <= p2x2) ? p2x1 : p2x2;
4564  double min_y1 = (p1y1 <= p1y2) ? p1y1 : p1y2;
4565  double min_y2 = (p2y1 <= p2y2) ? p2y1 : p2y2;
4566  result = (p.first >= min_x1 && p.first >= min_x2 && p.first <= max_x1 && p.first <= max_x2 &&
4567  p.second >= min_y1 && p.second >= min_y2 && p.second <= max_y1 && p.second <= max_y2);
4568  }
4569  }
4570 
4571  return result;
4572 }
4573 
4574 CLPoint* CLLayoutRenderer::calculate_intersection(double p1x, double p1y, double p1z, double sx, double sy, double sz,
4575  double p2x, double p2y, double p2z, double tx, double ty, double tz)
4576 {
4577  CLPoint* pP = NULL;
4578 
4579  if (fabs(sx) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4580  {
4581  double m = (p1y - p2y + ((p2x / sx) - (p1x / sx)) * sy) / (ty - tx * sy / sx);
4582  double n = (p2x + m * tx - p1x) / sx;
4583  pP = new CLPoint(p2x + m * tx, p2y + m * ty, p2z + m * tz);
4584  CLPoint* pP2 = new CLPoint(p1x + n * sx, p1y + n * sy, p1z + n * sz);
4585 
4586  if (fabs(pP->getX()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4587  {
4588  assert(fabs((pP->getX() - pP2->getX()) / pP->getX()) < 1e-6);
4589  }
4590  else
4591  {
4592  assert(fabs(pP2->getX()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4593  }
4594 
4595  if (fabs(pP->getY()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4596  {
4597  assert(fabs((pP->getY() - pP2->getY()) / pP->getY()) < 1e-6);
4598  }
4599  else
4600  {
4601  assert(fabs(pP2->getY()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4602  }
4603 
4604  if (fabs(pP->getZ()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4605  {
4606  assert(fabs((pP->getZ() - pP2->getZ()) / pP->getZ()) < 1e-6);
4607  }
4608  else
4609  {
4610  assert(fabs(pP2->getZ()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4611  }
4612 
4613  delete pP2;
4614  }
4615  else if (fabs(tx) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4616  {
4617  // first line is in the yz plane or a plane parallel to it
4618  // the intersection must be at p2x=p1x
4619  double m = (p1x - p2x) / tx;
4620  pP = new CLPoint(p2x + m * tx, p2y + m * ty, p2z + m * tz);
4621 
4622  if (fabs(sy) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4623  {
4624  double n = (pP->getY() - p1y) / sy;
4625  CLPoint* pP2 = new CLPoint(p1x + n * sx, p1y + n * sy, p1z + n * sz);
4626 
4627  if (fabs(pP->getX()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4628  {
4629  assert(fabs((pP->getX() - pP2->getX()) / pP->getX()) < 1e-6);
4630  }
4631  else
4632  {
4633  assert(fabs(pP2->getX()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4634  }
4635 
4636  if (fabs(pP->getY()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4637  {
4638  assert(fabs((pP->getY() - pP2->getY()) / pP->getY()) < 1e-6);
4639  }
4640  else
4641  {
4642  assert(fabs(pP2->getY()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4643  }
4644 
4645  if (fabs(pP->getZ()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4646  {
4647  assert(fabs((pP->getZ() - pP2->getZ()) / pP->getZ()) < 1e-6);
4648  }
4649  else
4650  {
4651  assert(fabs(pP2->getZ()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4652  }
4653 
4654  delete pP2;
4655  }
4656  else if (fabs(sz) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4657  {
4658  double n = (pP->getZ() - p1z) / sz;
4659  CLPoint* pP2 = new CLPoint(p1x + n * sx, p1y + n * sy, p1z + n * sz);
4660 
4661  if (fabs(pP->getX()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4662  {
4663  assert(fabs((pP->getX() - pP2->getX()) / pP->getX()) < 1e-6);
4664  }
4665  else
4666  {
4667  assert(fabs(pP2->getX()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4668  }
4669 
4670  if (fabs(pP->getY()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4671  {
4672  assert(fabs((pP->getY() - pP2->getY()) / pP->getY()) < 1e-6);
4673  }
4674  else
4675  {
4676  assert(fabs(pP2->getY()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4677  }
4678 
4679  if (fabs(pP->getZ()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4680  {
4681  assert(fabs((pP->getZ() - pP2->getZ()) / pP->getZ()) < 1e-6);
4682  }
4683  else
4684  {
4685  assert(fabs(pP2->getZ()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4686  }
4687 
4688  delete pP2;
4689  }
4690  }
4691  else
4692  {
4693  // both lines don't have a component in the x direction, so both must
4694  // lie in the yz plane or a plane parallel to it
4695  // there can only be an intersection if the x values are the same
4696  if (fabs(p1x - p2x) < ALMOST_ZERO)
4697  {
4698  // they are in the same plane
4699  if (fabs(sy) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4700  {
4701  double m = (p1z - p2z + (p2y / sy) * sz) / (tz - ty / sy * sz);
4702  double n = (p2y + m * ty) / sy;
4703  pP = new CLPoint(p2x + m * tx, p2y + m * ty, p2z + m * tz);
4704  CLPoint* pP2 = new CLPoint(p1x + n * sx, p1y + n * sy, p1z + n * sz);
4705 
4706  if (fabs(pP->getX()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4707  {
4708  assert(fabs((pP->getX() - pP2->getX()) / pP->getX()) < 1e-6);
4709  }
4710  else
4711  {
4712  assert(fabs(pP2->getX()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4713  }
4714 
4715  if (fabs(pP->getY()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4716  {
4717  assert(fabs((pP->getY() - pP2->getY()) / pP->getY()) < 1e-6);
4718  }
4719  else
4720  {
4721  assert(fabs(pP2->getY()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4722  }
4723 
4724  if (fabs(pP->getZ()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4725  {
4726  assert(fabs((pP->getZ() - pP2->getZ()) / pP->getZ()) < 1e-6);
4727  }
4728  else
4729  {
4730  assert(fabs(pP2->getZ()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4731  }
4732 
4733  delete pP2;
4734  }
4735  else if (fabs(ty) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4736  {
4737  double n = (p2z - p1z + (p2y / ty) * tz) / (sz - sy / ty * tz);
4738  double m = (p1y + n * sy) / ty;
4739  pP = new CLPoint(p2x + m * tx, p2y + m * ty, p2z + m * tz);
4740  CLPoint* pP2 = new CLPoint(p1x + n * sx, p1y + n * sy, p1z + n * sz);
4741 
4742  if (fabs(pP->getX()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4743  {
4744  assert(fabs((pP->getX() - pP2->getX()) / pP->getX()) < 1e-6);
4745  }
4746  else
4747  {
4748  assert(fabs(pP2->getX()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4749  }
4750 
4751  if (fabs(pP->getY()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4752  {
4753  assert(fabs((pP->getY() - pP2->getY()) / pP->getY()) < 1e-6);
4754  }
4755  else
4756  {
4757  assert(fabs(pP2->getY()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4758  }
4759 
4760  if (fabs(pP->getZ()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4761  {
4762  assert(fabs((pP->getZ() - pP2->getZ()) / pP->getZ()) < 1e-6);
4763  }
4764  else
4765  {
4766  assert(fabs(pP2->getZ()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4767  }
4768 
4769  delete pP2;
4770  }
4771  else if (fabs(sz) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4772  {
4773  double m = (p1y - p2y + (p2z / sz) * sy) / (ty - tz / sz * sy);
4774  double n = (p2z + m * tz) / sz;
4775  pP = new CLPoint(p2x + m * tx, p2y + m * ty, p2z + m * tz);
4776  CLPoint* pP2 = new CLPoint(p1x + n * sx, p1y + n * sy, p1z + n * sz);
4777 
4778  if (fabs(pP->getX()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4779  {
4780  assert(fabs((pP->getX() - pP2->getX()) / pP->getX()) < 1e-6);
4781  }
4782  else
4783  {
4784  assert(fabs(pP2->getX()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4785  }
4786 
4787  if (fabs(pP->getY()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4788  {
4789  assert(fabs((pP->getY() - pP2->getY()) / pP->getY()) < 1e-6);
4790  }
4791  else
4792  {
4793  assert(fabs(pP2->getY()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4794  }
4795 
4796  if (fabs(pP->getZ()) > ALMOST_ZERO)
4797  {
4798  assert(fabs((pP->getZ() - pP2->getZ()) / pP->getZ()) < 1e-6);
4799  }
4800  else
4801  {
4802  assert(fabs(pP2->getZ()) < ALMOST_ZERO);
4803  }
4804 
4805  delete pP2;
4806  }
4807  }
4808  }
4809 
4810  return pP;
4811 }
4812 
4813 /**
4814  * Sets whether the render extension is to deduce specie reference roles from associated
4815  * model objects if there are any.
4816  */
4817 void CLLayoutRenderer::setDeduceSpeciesReferenceRoles(bool deduce)
4818 {
4819  if (deduce != this->mDeduceSpeciesReferenceRoles)
4820  {
4821  this->mDeduceSpeciesReferenceRoles = deduce;
4822 
4823  if (this->mDeduceSpeciesReferenceRoles == true)
4824  {
4825  // try to deduce the roles and maybe update the style map
4826  if (this->mpLayout != NULL)
4827  {
4828  size_t i, iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfReactionGlyphs().size();
4829 
4830  if (iMax > 0)
4831  {
4832  CLReactionGlyph* pRG = NULL;
4833  CLMetabReferenceGlyph* pSRG = NULL;
4834  std::set<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*> speciesReferenceGlyphs;
4835  size_t j, jMax;
4836 
4837  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
4838  {
4839  pRG = this->mpLayout->getListOfReactionGlyphs()[i];
4840  jMax = pRG->getListOfMetabReferenceGlyphs().size();
4841 
4842  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
4843  {
4844  pSRG = pRG->getListOfMetabReferenceGlyphs()[j];
4845 
4846  if (pSRG->getObjectRole().empty() && !pSRG->getModelObjectKey().empty())
4847  {
4848  speciesReferenceGlyphs.insert(pSRG);
4849  }
4850  }
4851  }
4852 
4853  if (!speciesReferenceGlyphs.empty())
4854  {
4855  // collect all the species references with their putative role
4856  if (this->mpModel != NULL)
4857  {
4858  iMax = this->mpModel->getReactions().size();
4859 
4860  if (iMax > 0)
4861  {
4862  const CReaction* pReaction = NULL;
4863  const CChemEqElement* pSSR = NULL;
4864  std::map<std::string, std::string> speciesReferenceRoles;
4865 
4866  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
4867  {
4868  pReaction = this->mpModel->getReactions()[i];
4869  jMax = pReaction->getChemEq().getSubstrates().size();
4870 
4871  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
4872  {
4873  pSSR = pReaction->getChemEq().getSubstrates()[j];
4874 
4875  if (pReaction->isReversible())
4876  {
4877  speciesReferenceRoles[pSSR->getKey()] = "product";
4878  }
4879  else
4880  {
4881  speciesReferenceRoles[pSSR->getKey()] = "substrate";
4882  }
4883  }
4884 
4885  jMax = pReaction->getChemEq().getProducts().size();
4886 
4887  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
4888  {
4889  pSSR = pReaction->getChemEq().getProducts()[j];
4890  speciesReferenceRoles[pSSR->getKey()] = "product";
4891  }
4892 
4893  jMax = pReaction->getChemEq().getModifiers().size();
4894 
4895  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
4896  {
4897  pSSR = pReaction->getChemEq().getModifiers()[j];
4898  speciesReferenceRoles[pSSR->getKey()] = "modifier";
4899  }
4900  }
4901 
4902  if (!speciesReferenceRoles.empty())
4903  {
4904  std::set<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*>::iterator it = speciesReferenceGlyphs.begin(), endit = speciesReferenceGlyphs.end();
4905  std::map<std::string, std::string>::const_iterator pos, mapEnd = speciesReferenceRoles.end();
4906 
4907  // now we assign roles to the species reference glyphs
4908  while (it != endit)
4909  {
4910  pos = speciesReferenceRoles.find((*it)->getModelObjectKey());
4911 
4912  if (pos != mapEnd)
4913  {
4914  this->mSpeciesReferencesWithDeducedRole[*it] = pos->second;
4915  }
4916 
4917  ++it;
4918  }
4919 
4920  // check if we have to update the style mapping
4921  if (!this->mSpeciesReferencesWithDeducedRole.empty())
4922  {
4923  this->clear_cached_data();
4924 
4925  if (this->mpFontRenderer != NULL)
4926  {
4927  this->analyse_render_information(mX, mY, mX + mW / this->mZoomFactor, mY + mH / this->mZoomFactor);
4928  }
4929  }
4930  }
4931  }
4932  }
4933  }
4934  }
4935  }
4936  }
4937  else
4938  {
4939  // clear all deduced roles and update the style map
4940  if (!this->mSpeciesReferencesWithDeducedRole.empty())
4941  {
4942  this->mSpeciesReferencesWithDeducedRole.clear();
4943  // update the style mapping
4944  this->clear_cached_data();
4945 
4946  if (this->mpFontRenderer != NULL)
4947  {
4948  this->analyse_render_information(mX, mY, mX + mW / this->mZoomFactor, mY + mH / this->mZoomFactor);
4949  }
4950  }
4951  }
4952  }
4953 }
4954 
4955 /**
4956  * Returns true or false depending on whether the render extension
4957  * deduces specie reference roles from associated
4958  * model objects if there are any.
4959  */
4960 bool CLLayoutRenderer::isSetDeduceSpeciesReferenceRoles() const
4961 {
4962  return this->mDeduceSpeciesReferenceRoles;
4963 }
4964 
4965 /**
4966  * This method adds a graphical object to the set of selected objects.
4967  */
4968 void CLLayoutRenderer::addToSelection(CLGraphicalObject* pObject)
4969 {
4970  assert(pObject != NULL);
4971 
4972  if (this->mSelection.insert(pObject).second == true)
4973  {
4974  this->draw_layout();
4975  }
4976 }
4977 
4978 /**
4979  * This method removes the given object from the selection if
4980  * it is selected.
4981  */
4982 void CLLayoutRenderer::removeFromSelection(CLGraphicalObject* pObject)
4983 {
4984  std::set<CLGraphicalObject*>::iterator pos = this->mSelection.find(pObject);
4985 
4986  if (pos != this->mSelection.end())
4987  {
4988  this->mSelection.erase(pos);
4989  this->draw_layout();
4990  }
4991 }
4992 
4993 /**
4994  * This method returns a reference to the set of selected objects.
4995  */
4996 std::set<CLGraphicalObject*>& CLLayoutRenderer::getSelection()
4997 {
4998  return this->mSelection;
4999 }
5000 
5001 /**
5002  * This method returns a const reference to the set of selected objects.
5003  */
5004 const std::set<CLGraphicalObject*>& CLLayoutRenderer::getSelection() const
5005 {
5006  return this->mSelection;
5007 }
5008 
5009 /**
5010  * This method returns true if the given object is part of the selection and false otherwise.
5011  */
5012 bool CLLayoutRenderer::isSelected(const CLGraphicalObject* pObject) const
5013 {
5014  return (this->mSelection.find(const_cast<CLGraphicalObject*>(pObject)) != this->mSelection.end());
5015 }
5016 
5017 /**
5018  * This method clears the selection.
5019  */
5020 void CLLayoutRenderer::clearSelection()
5021 {
5022  if (!this->mSelection.empty())
5023  {
5024  this->mSelection.clear();
5025  }
5026 }
5027 
5028 /**
5029  * This method returns all objects at the given 2D model coordinates.
5030  * The depth value is ignored.
5031  */
5032 std::multiset<CLGraphicalObject*, compareGraphicalObjectsBySize> CLLayoutRenderer::getObjectsAt(double x, double y)
5033 {
5034  // if the given point is within the current viewport, we only have to check the current drawbles
5035  // else we have to look at all layout elements.
5036  std::multiset<CLGraphicalObject*, compareGraphicalObjectsBySize> hits;
5037 
5038  if ((x >= this->mX) && (x <= (this->mX + this->mW / this->mZoomFactor)) &&
5039  (y >= this->mY) && (y <= (this->mY + this->mH / this->mZoomFactor)))
5040  {
5041  std::vector<const CLGraphicalObject*>::const_iterator it = this->mDrawables.begin(), endit = this->mDrawables.end();
5042  const CLReactionGlyph* pRG = NULL;
5043  const CLMetabReferenceGlyph* pSRG = NULL;
5044  const CLBoundingBox* pBB = NULL;
5045  const CLCurve* pCurve = NULL;
5046  const CLLineSegment* pLS = NULL;
5047  double bbx, bby, bbwidth, bbheight;
5048  double toleranceRadius = 5.0 / this->mZoomFactor;
5049 
5050  while (it != endit)
5051  {
5052  pSRG = dynamic_cast<const CLMetabReferenceGlyph*>(*it);
5053  pRG = dynamic_cast<const CLReactionGlyph*>(*it);
5054 
5055  if (pSRG != NULL && pSRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
5056  {
5057  pCurve = &pSRG->getCurve();
5058  assert(pCurve != NULL);
5059  size_t i, iMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
5060 
5061  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
5062  {
5063  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(i);
5064  assert(pLS != NULL);
5065 
5066  if (isSegmentHit(pLS, x, y, toleranceRadius))
5067  {
5068  hits.insert(const_cast<CLGraphicalObject*>(*it));
5069  break;
5070  }
5071  }
5072  }
5073  else if (pRG != NULL && pRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments())
5074  {
5075  pCurve = &pRG->getCurve();
5076  assert(pCurve != NULL);
5077  size_t i, iMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
5078 
5079  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
5080  {
5081  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(i);
5082  assert(pLS != NULL);
5083 
5084  if (isSegmentHit(pLS, x, y, toleranceRadius))
5085  {
5086  hits.insert(const_cast<CLGraphicalObject*>(*it));
5087  break;
5088  }
5089  }
5090  }
5091  else
5092  {
5093  pBB = &(*it)->getBoundingBox();
5094  bbx = pBB->getPosition().getX();
5095  bby = pBB->getPosition().getY();
5096  bbwidth = pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
5097  bbheight = pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
5098 
5099  if (x >= bbx && y >= bby && x <= (bbx + bbwidth) && y <= (bby + bbheight))
5100  {
5101  hits.insert(const_cast<CLGraphicalObject*>(*it));
5102  }
5103  }
5104 
5105  ++it;
5106  }
5107  }
5108  else
5109  {
5110  if (this->mpLayout)
5111  {
5112  CLGraphicalObject* pGO = NULL;
5113  CLReactionGlyph* pRG = NULL;
5114  CLMetabReferenceGlyph* pSRG = NULL;
5115  const CLCurve* pCurve = NULL;
5116  const CLLineSegment* pLS = NULL;
5117  const CLBoundingBox* pBB = NULL;
5118  size_t k, kMax;
5119  size_t j, jMax;
5120  double bbx, bby, bbwidth, bbheight;
5121  double toleranceRadius = 5.0 / this->mZoomFactor;
5122  size_t i, iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfCompartmentGlyphs().size();
5123 
5124  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
5125  {
5126  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfCompartmentGlyphs()[i];
5127  pBB = &pGO->getBoundingBox();
5128  bbx = pBB->getPosition().getX();
5129  bby = pBB->getPosition().getY();
5130  bbwidth = pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
5131  bbheight = pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
5132 
5133  if (x >= bbx && y >= bby && x <= (bbx + bbwidth) && y <= (bby + bbheight))
5134  {
5135  hits.insert(pGO);
5136  }
5137  }
5138 
5139  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfMetaboliteGlyphs().size();
5140 
5141  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
5142  {
5143  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfMetaboliteGlyphs()[i];
5144  pBB = &pGO->getBoundingBox();
5145  bbx = pBB->getPosition().getX();
5146  bby = pBB->getPosition().getY();
5147  bbwidth = pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
5148  bbheight = pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
5149 
5150  if (x >= bbx && y >= bby && x <= (bbx + bbwidth) && y <= (bby + bbheight))
5151  {
5152  hits.insert(pGO);
5153  }
5154  }
5155 
5156  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfReactionGlyphs().size();
5157 
5158  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
5159  {
5160  pRG = this->mpLayout->getListOfReactionGlyphs()[i];
5161  assert(pRG != NULL);
5162 
5163  // we have to look at all points of the curve if there is one
5164  if (pRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
5165  {
5166  pCurve = &pRG->getCurve();
5167  assert(pCurve != NULL);
5168  kMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
5169 
5170  for (k = 0; k < kMax; ++k)
5171  {
5172  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(k);
5173  assert(pLS != NULL);
5174 
5175  if (isSegmentHit(pLS, x, y, toleranceRadius))
5176  {
5177  hits.insert(pRG);
5178  break;
5179  }
5180  }
5181  }
5182  else
5183  {
5184  pBB = &pRG->getBoundingBox();
5185  bbx = pBB->getPosition().getX();
5186  bby = pBB->getPosition().getY();
5187  bbwidth = pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
5188  bbheight = pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
5189 
5190  if (x >= bbx && y >= bby && x <= (bbx + bbwidth) && y <= (bby + bbheight))
5191  {
5192  hits.insert(pRG);
5193  }
5194  }
5195 
5196  jMax = pRG->getListOfMetabReferenceGlyphs().size();
5197 
5198  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
5199  {
5200  pSRG = pRG->getListOfMetabReferenceGlyphs()[j];
5201  assert(pSRG != NULL);
5202 
5203  // we have to look at all points of the curve if there is one
5204  if (pSRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
5205  {
5206  pCurve = &pSRG->getCurve();
5207  assert(pCurve != NULL);
5208  kMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
5209  bool drawn = false;
5210 
5211  for (k = 0; k < kMax && !drawn; ++k)
5212  {
5213  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(k);
5214 
5215  if (isSegmentHit(pLS, x, y, toleranceRadius))
5216  {
5217  hits.insert(pSRG);
5218  break;
5219  }
5220  }
5221  }
5222  else
5223  {
5224  pBB = &pSRG->getBoundingBox();
5225  bbx = pBB->getPosition().getX();
5226  bby = pBB->getPosition().getY();
5227  bbwidth = pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
5228  bbheight = pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
5229 
5230  if (x >= bbx && y >= bby && x <= (bbx + bbwidth) && y <= (bby + bbheight))
5231  {
5232  hits.insert(pSRG);
5233  }
5234  }
5235  }
5236  }
5237 
5238  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfTextGlyphs().size();
5239 
5240  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
5241  {
5242  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfTextGlyphs()[i];
5243  pBB = &pGO->getBoundingBox();
5244  bbx = pBB->getPosition().getX();
5245  bby = pBB->getPosition().getY();
5246  bbwidth = pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
5247  bbheight = pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
5248 
5249  if (x >= bbx && y >= bby && x <= (bbx + bbwidth) && y <= (bby + bbheight))
5250  {
5251  hits.insert(pGO);
5252  }
5253  }
5254 
5255  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfGeneralGlyphs().size();
5256 
5257  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
5258  {
5259  CLGeneralGlyph* pGG = this->mpLayout->getListOfGeneralGlyphs()[i];
5260  assert(pGG != NULL);
5261 
5262  // we have to look at all points of the curve if there is one
5263  if (pGG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
5264  {
5265  pCurve = &pGG->getCurve();
5266  assert(pCurve != NULL);
5267  kMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
5268 
5269  for (k = 0; k < kMax; ++k)
5270  {
5271  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(k);
5272  assert(pLS != NULL);
5273 
5274  if (isSegmentHit(pLS, x, y, toleranceRadius))
5275  {
5276  hits.insert(pGG);
5277  break;
5278  }
5279  }
5280  }
5281  else
5282  {
5283  pBB = &pGG->getBoundingBox();
5284  bbx = pBB->getPosition().getX();
5285  bby = pBB->getPosition().getY();
5286  bbwidth = pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
5287  bbheight = pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
5288 
5289  if (x >= bbx && y >= bby && x <= (bbx + bbwidth) && y <= (bby + bbheight))
5290  {
5291  hits.insert(pRG);
5292  }
5293  }
5294 
5295  jMax = pGG->getListOfReferenceGlyphs().size();
5296 
5297  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
5298  {
5299  CLReferenceGlyph* pRefG = pGG->getListOfReferenceGlyphs()[j];
5300  assert(pRefG != NULL);
5301 
5302  // we have to look at all points of the curve if there is one
5303  if (pRefG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
5304  {
5305  pCurve = &pRefG->getCurve();
5306  assert(pCurve != NULL);
5307  kMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
5308  bool drawn = false;
5309 
5310  for (k = 0; k < kMax && !drawn; ++k)
5311  {
5312  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(k);
5313 
5314  if (isSegmentHit(pLS, x, y, toleranceRadius))
5315  {
5316  hits.insert(pSRG);
5317  break;
5318  }
5319  }
5320  }
5321  else
5322  {
5323  pBB = &pRefG->getBoundingBox();
5324  bbx = pBB->getPosition().getX();
5325  bby = pBB->getPosition().getY();
5326  bbwidth = pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
5327  bbheight = pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
5328 
5329  if (x >= bbx && y >= bby && x <= (bbx + bbwidth) && y <= (bby + bbheight))
5330  {
5331  hits.insert(pRefG);
5332  }
5333  }
5334  }
5335  }
5336  }
5337  }
5338 
5339  return hits;
5340 }
5341 
5342 /**
5343  * This method returns all objects at the given 2D screen coordinates.
5344  * The depth value is ignored.
5345  */
5346 std::multiset<CLGraphicalObject*, compareGraphicalObjectsBySize> CLLayoutRenderer::getObjectsAtViewportPosition(unsigned int x, unsigned int y)
5347 {
5348  // first we convert the viewport position to model coordinates
5349  std::pair<double, double> coords = this->convert_to_model_space(x, y);
5350  return this->getObjectsAt(coords.first, coords.second);
5351 }
5352 
5353 /**
5354  * Calculates if the point given as x,y is close enough to the given line segment
5355  * to count as a hit.
5356  */
5357 bool CLLayoutRenderer::isSegmentHit(const CLLineSegment* pLS, double x, double y, double toleranceRadius)
5358 {
5359  bool result = false;
5360 
5361  if (pLS->isBezier())
5362  {
5363  // check if the point is within an extended bounding box
5364  double x1, x2, x3, x4, y1, y2, y3, y4;
5365  x1 = pLS->getStart().getX();
5366  x2 = pLS->getBase1().getX();
5367  x3 = pLS->getBase2().getX();
5368  x4 = pLS->getEnd().getX();
5369  y1 = pLS->getStart().getY();
5370  y2 = pLS->getBase1().getY();
5371  y3 = pLS->getBase2().getY();
5372  y4 = pLS->getEnd().getY();
5373  double maxX = (x1 > x2) ? x1 : x2;
5374  maxX = (maxX > x3) ? maxX : x3;
5375  maxX = (maxX > x4) ? maxX : x4;
5376  double maxY = (y1 > y2) ? y1 : y2;
5377  maxY = (maxY > y3) ? maxY : y3;
5378  maxY = (maxY > y4) ? maxY : y4;
5379  double minX = (x1 < x2) ? x1 : x2;
5380  minX = (minX < x3) ? minX : x3;
5381  minX = (minX < x4) ? minX : x4;
5382  double minY = (y1 < y2) ? y1 : y2;
5383  minY = (minY < y3) ? minY : y3;
5384  minY = (minY < y4) ? minY : y4;
5385  minX -= toleranceRadius;
5386  minY -= toleranceRadius;
5387  maxX += toleranceRadius;
5388  maxY += toleranceRadius;
5389 
5390  if (x >= minX && y >= minY && x <= maxX && y <= maxY)
5391  {
5392  // calculate points to get line segments and check each one for a hit
5393  GLdouble* pData = new GLdouble[3 * NUM_BEZIER_POINTS];
5394  CLLayoutRenderer::calculate_cubicbezier(x1, y1, 0.0, x2, y2, 0.0, x3, y3, 0.0, x4, y4, 0.0, NUM_BEZIER_POINTS, pData);
5395  size_t i;
5396  double distance = 0.0;
5397 
5398  for (i = 1; i < NUM_BEZIER_POINTS && !result; ++i)
5399  {
5400  distance = distancePointLineSegment(x, y, pData[(i - 1) * 3], pData[(i - 1) * 3 + 1], pData[i * 3], pData[i * 3 + 1]);
5401  result = (distance == distance && distance <= toleranceRadius);
5402  }
5403  }
5404  else
5405  {
5406  result = false;
5407  }
5408  }
5409  else
5410  {
5411  double distance = distancePointLineSegment(x, y, pLS->getStart().getX(), pLS->getStart().getY(), pLS->getEnd().getX(), pLS->getEnd().getY());
5412  result = (distance == distance && distance <= toleranceRadius);
5413  }
5414 
5415  return result;
5416 }
5417 
5418 double CLLayoutRenderer::distancePointLineSegment(double x, double y, double lx1, double ly1, double lx2, double ly2)
5419 {
5420  double dx = lx2 - lx1;
5421  double dy = ly2 - ly1;
5422  double distance = std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
5423 
5424  if (fabs(dx) <= 1e-9)
5425  {
5426  if (fabs(dy) > 1e-9)
5427  {
5428  if (y >= ((ly1 < ly2) ? ly1 : ly2) && y <= ((ly1 > ly2) ? ly1 : ly2))
5429  {
5430  distance = fabs(lx1 - x);
5431  }
5432  }
5433  }
5434  else if (fabs(dy) <= 1e-9)
5435  {
5436  if (x >= ((lx1 < lx2) ? lx1 : lx2) && x <= ((lx1 > lx2) ? lx1 : lx2))
5437  {
5438  distance = fabs(ly1 - y);
5439  }
5440  }
5441  else
5442  {
5443  double slope = dy / dx;
5444  double invslope = -1.0 * dx / dy;
5445  double xCross = (-invslope * x + slope * lx1 + y - ly1) / (slope - invslope);
5446 
5447  if ((xCross >= ((lx1 < lx2) ? lx1 : lx2)) && (xCross <= (((lx1 > lx2) ? lx1 : lx2))))
5448  {
5449  double yCross = slope * (xCross - lx1) + ly1;
5450 
5451  if ((yCross >= ((ly1 < ly2) ? ly1 : ly2)) && (yCross <= (((ly1 > ly2) ? ly1 : ly2))))
5452  {
5453  distance = sqrt(pow(x - xCross, 2) + pow(y - yCross, 2));
5454  }
5455  else
5456  {
5457  if (fabs(lx1 - xCross) < fabs(lx2 - xCross))
5458  {
5459  // the distance to lx2.ly2 is smaller
5460  distance = sqrt(pow(x - lx2, 2) + pow(y - ly2, 2));
5461  }
5462  else
5463  {
5464  distance = sqrt(pow(x - lx1, 2) + pow(y - ly1, 2));
5465  }
5466  }
5467  }
5468  else
5469  {
5470  if (fabs(lx1 - xCross) < fabs(lx2 - xCross))
5471  {
5472  // the distance to lx2.ly2 is smaller
5473  distance = sqrt(pow(x - lx2, 2) + pow(y - ly2, 2));
5474  }
5475  else
5476  {
5477  distance = sqrt(pow(x - lx1, 2) + pow(y - ly1, 2));
5478  }
5479  }
5480  }
5481 
5482  return distance;
5483 }
5484 
5485 /**
5486  * Calculates the bounding box of the curve by looking at all the basepoints.
5487  * The returned boundingbox object has to be deleted by the caller.
5488  */
5489 CLBoundingBox* CLLayoutRenderer::getCurveBoundingBox(const CLCurve* pCurve)
5490 {
5491 #ifdef _WIN32
5492 // windows seems to declare a macro called max which clashes with the
5493 // call to mac from numeric limits
5494 #undef max
5495 #endif // _WIN32
5496  double xMin = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
5497  double yMin = xMin;
5498  double xMax = -xMin;
5499  double yMax = xMax;
5500  size_t i, iMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
5501  const CLLineSegment* pLS = NULL;
5502 
5503  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
5504  {
5505  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(i);
5506  xMin = (xMin <= pLS->getStart().getX()) ? xMin : pLS->getStart().getX();
5507  yMin = (yMin <= pLS->getStart().getY()) ? yMin : pLS->getStart().getY();
5508  xMax = (xMax >= pLS->getStart().getX()) ? xMax : pLS->getStart().getX();
5509  yMax = (yMax >= pLS->getStart().getY()) ? yMax : pLS->getStart().getY();
5510  xMin = (xMin <= pLS->getEnd().getX()) ? xMin : pLS->getEnd().getX();
5511  yMin = (yMin <= pLS->getEnd().getY()) ? yMin : pLS->getEnd().getY();
5512  xMax = (xMax >= pLS->getEnd().getX()) ? xMax : pLS->getEnd().getX();
5513  yMax = (yMax >= pLS->getEnd().getY()) ? yMax : pLS->getEnd().getY();
5514 
5515  if (pLS->isBezier())
5516  {
5517  xMin = (xMin <= pLS->getBase1().getX()) ? xMin : pLS->getBase1().getX();
5518  yMin = (yMin <= pLS->getBase1().getY()) ? yMin : pLS->getBase1().getY();
5519  xMax = (xMax >= pLS->getBase1().getX()) ? xMax : pLS->getBase1().getX();
5520  yMax = (yMax >= pLS->getBase1().getY()) ? yMax : pLS->getBase1().getY();
5521  xMin = (xMin <= pLS->getBase2().getX()) ? xMin : pLS->getBase2().getX();
5522  yMin = (yMin <= pLS->getBase2().getY()) ? yMin : pLS->getBase2().getY();
5523  xMax = (xMax >= pLS->getBase2().getX()) ? xMax : pLS->getBase2().getX();
5524  yMax = (yMax >= pLS->getBase2().getY()) ? yMax : pLS->getBase2().getY();
5525  }
5526  }
5527 
5528  return new CLBoundingBox(CLPoint(xMin, yMin), CLDimensions(xMax - xMin, yMax - yMin));
5529 }
5530 
5531 /**
5532  * Draw the selection frame around an graphical objects bounding object box.
5533  * If drawHandles is true, resize handles are drawn as well,
5534  * else only the box is drawn.
5535  * If the curve is given, the basepoints of the curve are also drawn
5536  * as small circles.
5537  */
5538 void CLLayoutRenderer::drawSelectionBox(double x, double y, double width, double height, bool /*drawHandles*/)
5539 {
5540  // first we draw the actual box
5541  // and we use a stippled line of width 2
5542  // if the OpenGL implementation does not support different line width,
5543  // we don't care, it will probably just look better if it does.
5544  glPushMatrix();
5545  glTranslated(x - SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, y - SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, 0.0);
5546  glEnable(GL_LINE_STIPPLE);
5547  glLineStipple(10, 0x5555);
5548  glLineWidth(2.0);
5549  // first we draw a box with a black line and line stippling
5550  // we have to extend the box a bit to have a small space between the object and the frame
5551  glColor3f(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
5552  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5553  glVertex3d(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
5554  glVertex3d(width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, 0.0, 0.0);
5555  glVertex3d(width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, 0.0);
5556  glVertex3d(0.0, height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, 0.0);
5557  glEnd();
5558  // now we draw the same box again, but in white and with reversed line stippling
5559  glColor3f(1.0, 1.0, 1.0);
5560  glLineStipple(10, ~0x5555);
5561  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5562  glVertex3d(0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
5563  glVertex3d(width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, 0.0, 0.0);
5564  glVertex3d(width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, 0.0);
5565  glVertex3d(0.0, height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH, 0.0);
5566  glEnd();
5567  glDisable(GL_LINE_STIPPLE);
5568  /*
5569  * For now we disable handle drawing until we make the handles functional.
5570  if(drawHandles == true)
5571  {
5572  // draw the handles
5573  // we draw 8 handles, one on each corner
5574  // and one on each side
5575  GLdouble* pArrowData=new GLdouble[3*7];
5576  // point 1
5577  pArrowData[0]=8.0;
5578  pArrowData[1]=3.0;
5579  pArrowData[2]=0.0;
5580 
5581  // point 2
5582  pArrowData[3]=0.0;
5583  pArrowData[4]=3.0;
5584  pArrowData[5]=0.0;
5585  // point 3
5586  pArrowData[6]=0.0;
5587  pArrowData[7]=-3.0;
5588  pArrowData[8]=0.0;
5589 
5590  // point 4
5591  pArrowData[9]=8.0;
5592  pArrowData[10]=-3.0;
5593  pArrowData[11]=0.0;
5594 
5595  // point 5
5596  pArrowData[12]=6.0;
5597  pArrowData[13]=-6.0;
5598  pArrowData[14]=0.0;
5599 
5600  // point 6
5601  pArrowData[15]=14.0;
5602  pArrowData[16]=0.0;
5603  pArrowData[17]=0.0;
5604 
5605  // point 7
5606  pArrowData[18]=6.0;
5607  pArrowData[19]=6.0;
5608  pArrowData[20]=0.0;
5609 
5610  size_t i;
5611  // right
5612  glPushMatrix();
5613  glTranslatef(width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH + 3, (height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH)/ 2.0 ,0.0);
5614  // white polygon
5615  glColor3f(1.0,1.0,1.0);
5616  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5617  for(i=0;i<4;++i)
5618  {
5619  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5620  }
5621  glEnd();
5622  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5623  for(i=4;i<7;++i)
5624  {
5625  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5626  }
5627  glVertex3f(pArrowData[0],pArrowData[1],pArrowData[2]);
5628  glEnd();
5629  // with black border
5630  glColor3f(0.0,0.0,0.0);
5631  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5632  for(i=0;i<7;++i)
5633  {
5634  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5635  }
5636  glEnd();
5637  glPopMatrix();
5638  //
5639  // bottom
5640  glPushMatrix();
5641  glTranslatef((width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH ) / 2.0 , height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH + 3.0,0.0);
5642  glRotatef(90,0.0,0.0,1.0);
5643  // white polygon
5644  glColor3f(1.0,1.0,1.0);
5645  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5646  for(i=0;i<4;++i)
5647  {
5648  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5649  }
5650  glEnd();
5651  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5652  for(i=4;i<7;++i)
5653  {
5654  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5655  }
5656  glVertex3f(pArrowData[0],pArrowData[1],pArrowData[2]);
5657  glEnd();
5658  // with black border
5659  glColor3f(0.0,0.0,0.0);
5660  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5661  for(i=0;i<7;++i)
5662  {
5663  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5664  }
5665  glEnd();
5666  glPopMatrix();
5667  //
5668  // left
5669  glPushMatrix();
5670  glTranslatef(- 3, (height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH)/ 2.0 ,0.0);
5671  glRotatef(180,0.0,0.0,1.0);
5672  // white polygon
5673  glColor3f(1.0,1.0,1.0);
5674  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5675  for(i=0;i<4;++i)
5676  {
5677  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5678  }
5679  glEnd();
5680  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5681  for(i=4;i<7;++i)
5682  {
5683  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5684  }
5685  glVertex3f(pArrowData[0],pArrowData[1],pArrowData[2]);
5686  glEnd();
5687  // with black border
5688  glColor3f(0.0,0.0,0.0);
5689  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5690  for(i=0;i<7;++i)
5691  {
5692  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5693  }
5694  glEnd();
5695  glPopMatrix();
5696  // top
5697  glPushMatrix();
5698  glTranslatef((width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH) / 2.0 , -3.0,0.0);
5699  glRotatef(-90,0.0,0.0,1.0);
5700  // white polygon
5701  glColor3f(1.0,1.0,1.0);
5702  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5703  for(i=0;i<4;++i)
5704  {
5705  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5706  }
5707  glEnd();
5708  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5709  for(i=4;i<7;++i)
5710  {
5711  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5712  }
5713  glVertex3f(pArrowData[0],pArrowData[1],pArrowData[2]);
5714  glEnd();
5715  // with black border
5716  glColor3f(0.0,0.0,0.0);
5717  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5718  for(i=0;i<7;++i)
5719  {
5720  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5721  }
5722  glEnd();
5723  glPopMatrix();
5724 
5725  //
5726  // left top corner
5727  glPushMatrix();
5728  glTranslatef(-3.0, -3.0,0.0);
5729  glRotatef(225,0.0,0.0,1.0);
5730  // white polygon
5731  glColor3f(1.0,1.0,1.0);
5732  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5733  for(i=0;i<4;++i)
5734  {
5735  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5736  }
5737  glEnd();
5738  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5739  for(i=4;i<7;++i)
5740  {
5741  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5742  }
5743  glVertex3f(pArrowData[0],pArrowData[1],pArrowData[2]);
5744  glEnd();
5745  // with black border
5746  glColor3f(0.0,0.0,0.0);
5747  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5748  for(i=0;i<7;++i)
5749  {
5750  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5751  }
5752  glEnd();
5753  glPopMatrix();
5754  //
5755  // right top corner
5756  glPushMatrix();
5757  glTranslatef((width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH) + 3.0, - 3.0,0.0);
5758  glRotatef(315,0.0,0.0,1.0);
5759  // white polygon
5760  glColor3f(1.0,1.0,1.0);
5761  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5762  for(i=0;i<4;++i)
5763  {
5764  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5765  }
5766  glEnd();
5767  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5768  for(i=4;i<7;++i)
5769  {
5770  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5771  }
5772  glVertex3f(pArrowData[0],pArrowData[1],pArrowData[2]);
5773  glEnd();
5774  // with black border
5775  glColor3f(0.0,0.0,0.0);
5776  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5777  for(i=0;i<7;++i)
5778  {
5779  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5780  }
5781  glEnd();
5782  glPopMatrix();
5783  //
5784  // right bottom corner
5785  glPushMatrix();
5786  glTranslatef(width + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH + 3.0, (height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH) + 3.0,0.0);
5787  glRotatef(45,0.0,0.0,1.0);
5788  // white polygon
5789  glColor3f(1.0,1.0,1.0);
5790  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5791  for(i=0;i<4;++i)
5792  {
5793  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5794  }
5795  glEnd();
5796  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5797  for(i=4;i<7;++i)
5798  {
5799  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5800  }
5801  glVertex3f(pArrowData[0],pArrowData[1],pArrowData[2]);
5802  glEnd();
5803  // with black border
5804  glColor3f(0.0,0.0,0.0);
5805  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5806  for(i=0;i<7;++i)
5807  {
5808  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5809  }
5810  glEnd();
5811  glPopMatrix();
5812  //
5813  // left bottom corner
5814  glPushMatrix();
5815  glTranslatef(-3.0 ,(height + 2 * SELECTION_FRAME_WIDTH) + 3.0,0.0);
5816  glRotatef(135,0.0,0.0,1.0);
5817  // white polygon
5818  glColor3f(1.0,1.0,1.0);
5819  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5820  for(i=0;i<4;++i)
5821  {
5822  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5823  }
5824  glEnd();
5825  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
5826  for(i=4;i<7;++i)
5827  {
5828  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5829  }
5830  glVertex3f(pArrowData[0],pArrowData[1],pArrowData[2]);
5831  glEnd();
5832  // with black border
5833  glColor3f(0.0,0.0,0.0);
5834  glBegin(GL_LINE_LOOP);
5835  for(i=0;i<7;++i)
5836  {
5837  glVertex3f(pArrowData[i*3],pArrowData[i*3+1],pArrowData[i*3+2]);
5838  }
5839  glEnd();
5840  glPopMatrix();
5841  delete[] pArrowData;
5842  }
5843  */
5844  glLineWidth(1.0);
5845  glPopMatrix();
5846 }
5847 
5848 /**
5849  * Checks if the given curve segment would be visible in the box determined by lx,ly,rx,ry.
5850  * If the curve in any way intersects the box, true is returned.
5851  */
5852 bool CLLayoutRenderer::is_curve_segment_visible(const CLLineSegment& segment, double lx, double ly, double rx, double ry, bool partial)
5853 {
5854  bool result = false;
5855  CLPoint start, end, b1, b2;
5856  start = segment.getStart();
5857  double x, y;
5858  x = start.getX();
5859  y = start.getY();
5860 
5861  if (partial)
5862  {
5863  // if the point is in the viewport, we draw the whole curve
5864  if (x >= lx && x <= rx && y >= ly && y <= ry)
5865  {
5866  result = true;
5867  }
5868  }
5869  else
5870  {
5871  if (x < lx || y < ly || x > rx || y > ry)
5872  {
5873  result = false;
5874  }
5875  }
5876 
5877  end = segment.getEnd();
5878  x = end.getX();
5879  y = end.getY();
5880 
5881  if (partial)
5882  {
5883  // if the point is in the viewport, we draw the whole curve
5884  if (x >= lx && x <= rx && y >= ly && y <= ry)
5885  {
5886  result = true;
5887  }
5888  }
5889  else
5890  {
5891  if (x < lx || y < ly || x > rx || y > ry)
5892  {
5893  result = false;
5894  }
5895  }
5896 
5897  if (segment.isBezier())
5898  {
5899  b1 = segment.getBase1();
5900  x = b1.getX();
5901  y = b1.getY();
5902 
5903  if (partial)
5904  {
5905  // if the point is in the viewport, we draw the whole curve
5906  if (x >= lx && x <= rx && y >= ly && y <= ry)
5907  {
5908  result = true;
5909  }
5910  }
5911  else
5912  {
5913  if (x < lx || y < ly || x > rx || y > ry)
5914  {
5915  result = false;
5916  }
5917  }
5918 
5919  b2 = segment.getBase2();
5920  x = b2.getX();
5921  y = b2.getY();
5922 
5923  if (partial)
5924  {
5925  // if the point is in the viewport, we draw the whole curve
5926  if (x >= lx && x <= rx && y >= ly && y <= ry)
5927  {
5928  result = true;
5929  }
5930  }
5931  else
5932  {
5933  if (x < lx || y < ly || x > rx || y > ry)
5934  {
5935  result = false;
5936  }
5937  }
5938 
5939  // with bezier curves it can happen that all
5940  // base points are outside the view port, but
5941  // the curve still intersects the viewport.
5942  //
5943  // One simple strategy would be to calculate additional curve points
5944  // and check if those are within the bounding box.
5945  // Since we do not want to calculate too many points, we need some measure
5946  // as to how many points would be necessary.
5947  //
5948  // A strategy that might work is to consider the size of the trapezoid around
5949  // the bezier as well as the size of the viewport.
5950  // The smaller the viewport, the more points we need to make sure we find one
5951  // that is within the viewport. Conversly, the larger the trapezoid, the more
5952  // points we need to find one that is within the viewport.
5953 
5954  if (!result)
5955  {
5956  // as a measure of the size of the trapezoid, we use the longest distance of
5957  // start-end, start-bp1, end-bp2
5958  //
5959  // actually since we are only dealing with 2D data right now, I probably should not
5960  // consider the Z values for the calculation of the length, but on
5961  // the other hand, it shouldn't hurt either.
5962  double maxL = pow(start.getX() - end.getX(), 2) + pow(start.getY() - end.getY(), 2) + pow(start.getZ() - end.getZ(), 2);
5963  double temp = pow(start.getX() - b1.getX(), 2) + pow(start.getY() - b1.getY(), 2) + pow(start.getZ() - b1.getZ(), 2);
5964  maxL = (temp > maxL) ? temp : maxL;
5965  temp = pow(end.getX() - b2.getX(), 2) + pow(end.getY() - b2.getY(), 2) + pow(end.getZ() - b2.getZ(), 2);
5966  maxL = (temp > maxL) ? temp : maxL;
5967  maxL = sqrt(maxL);
5968  double minV = (fabs(lx - rx) > fabs(ly - ry)) ? fabs(lx - rx) : fabs(ly - ry);
5969  // we multiply the ratio with a constant to get the number of points that
5970  // we need to calculate
5971  unsigned int numPoints = (unsigned int)floor(maxL / minV * 6.0);
5972 
5973  // the 10000 cutoff is just a safety net
5974  if (numPoints != 0 && fabs(minV) != std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity() && numPoints < 10000)
5975  {
5976  // now we calculate the points
5977  // we have to include the start and end point
5978  numPoints += 2;
5979  GLdouble* pData = new GLdouble[3 * numPoints];
5980  CLLayoutRenderer::calculate_cubicbezier(start.getX(), start.getY(), start.getZ(),
5981  b1.getX(), b1.getY(), b1.getZ(),
5982  b2.getX(), b2.getY(), b2.getZ(),
5983  end.getX(), end.getY(), end.getZ(),
5984  numPoints, pData);
5985  // we don't need to test the start and endpoint again
5986  CLLineSegment temp_ls;
5987  temp_ls.setIsBezier(false);
5988  CLPoint p(pData[0], pData[1]
5989  , pData[2]
5990  );
5991  temp_ls.setStart(p);
5992 
5993  for (unsigned int i = 1; i < numPoints; ++i)
5994  {
5995  p.setX(pData[3 * i]);
5996  p.setY(pData[3 * i + 1]);
5997  p.setZ(pData[3 * i + 2]);
5998  temp_ls.setEnd(p);
5999 
6000  if (CLLayoutRenderer::is_curve_segment_visible(temp_ls, lx, ly, rx, ry, partial))
6001  {
6002  result = true;
6003  break;
6004  }
6005 
6006  temp_ls.setStart(temp_ls.getEnd());
6007  }
6008 
6009  delete[] pData;
6010  }
6011  }
6012  }
6013  // if we have a line segment and so far it would not be drawn
6014  // we check if the end points lie outside the boundingbox, but
6015  // the line crosses anyway
6016  else if (!result)
6017  {
6018  std::vector<std::pair<CLPoint, CLPoint> > edge;
6019  edge.push_back(std::pair<CLPoint, CLPoint>(CLPoint(lx, ly), CLPoint(rx, ly)));
6020  edge.push_back(std::pair<CLPoint, CLPoint>(CLPoint(lx, ly), CLPoint(lx, ry)));
6021  edge.push_back(std::pair<CLPoint, CLPoint>(CLPoint(rx, ry), CLPoint(rx, ly)));
6022  edge.push_back(std::pair<CLPoint, CLPoint>(CLPoint(rx, ry), CLPoint(lx, ry)));
6023  // check if the segment crosses the viewport border
6024  std::vector<std::pair<CLPoint, CLPoint> >::const_iterator edge_it = edge.begin(), edge_endit = edge.end();
6025 
6026  while (edge_it != edge_endit)
6027  {
6028  // we pass the edge points in first because these are usually parallel to the x or y
6029  // axis, so this makes checking for intersections easier since the slopes for the
6030  // first line segment are considered first.
6031  if (CLLayoutRenderer::segments_intersect_2d(edge_it->first.getX(), edge_it->first.getY(), edge_it->second.getX(), edge_it->second.getY(),
6032  start.getX(), start.getY(), end.getX(), end.getY()))
6033  {
6034  result = true;
6035  break;
6036  }
6037 
6038  ++edge_it;
6039  }
6040  }
6041 
6042  return result;
6043 }
6044 
6045 /**
6046  * Checks if the given curve would be visible in the box determined by lx,ly,rx,ry.
6047  * If the curve in any way intersects the box, true is returned.
6048  */
6049 bool CLLayoutRenderer::is_curve_visible(const CLCurve& curve, double lx, double ly, double rx, double ry, bool partial)
6050 {
6051  bool result = false;
6052 
6053  if (!partial)
6054  {
6055  result = true;
6056  }
6057 
6058  size_t k, kMax = curve.getNumCurveSegments();
6059  const CLLineSegment* pLS = NULL;
6060 
6061  for (k = 0; k < kMax && !result; ++k)
6062  {
6063  pLS = curve.getSegmentAt(k);
6064  assert(pLS != NULL);
6065  result = CLLayoutRenderer::is_curve_segment_visible(*pLS, lx, ly, rx, ry, partial);
6066  }
6067 
6068  return result;
6069 }
6070 
6071 /**
6072  * Returns all objects that are within a given bounding box.
6073  */
6074 std::vector<CLGraphicalObject*> CLLayoutRenderer::getObjectsInBoundingBox(double lx, double ly, double rx, double ry, bool partial)
6075 {
6076  std::vector<CLGraphicalObject*> result;
6077 
6078  if (this->mpLayout)
6079  {
6080  CLGraphicalObject* pGO = NULL;
6081  CLReactionGlyph* pRG = NULL;
6082  CLMetabReferenceGlyph* pSRG = NULL;
6083  const CLBoundingBox* pBB = NULL;
6084  size_t j, jMax;
6085  double x, y;
6086  size_t i, iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfCompartmentGlyphs().size();
6087 
6088  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6089  {
6090  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfCompartmentGlyphs()[i];
6091  pBB = &pGO->getBoundingBox();
6092  x = pBB->getPosition().getX();
6093  y = pBB->getPosition().getY();
6094 
6095  // if the upper left is right of or below the current viewport, the
6096  // object is not drawn
6097  if (partial)
6098  {
6099  if (!(x > rx || y > ry))
6100  {
6101  // or if the lower right is left of or above the current viewport
6102  // the object is also not drawn
6103  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6104  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6105 
6106  if (!(x < lx || y < ly))
6107  {
6108  result.push_back(pGO);
6109  }
6110  }
6111  }
6112  else
6113  {
6114  // the object has to completly within the box
6115  if (x >= lx && y >= ly)
6116  {
6117  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6118  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6119 
6120  if ((x <= rx && y <= ry))
6121  {
6122  result.push_back(pGO);
6123  }
6124  }
6125  }
6126  }
6127 
6128  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfMetaboliteGlyphs().size();
6129 
6130  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6131  {
6132  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfMetaboliteGlyphs()[i];
6133  pBB = &pGO->getBoundingBox();
6134  x = pBB->getPosition().getX();
6135  y = pBB->getPosition().getY();
6136 
6137  // if the upper left is right of or below the current viewport, the
6138  // object is not drawn
6139  if (partial)
6140  {
6141  if (!(x > rx || y > ry))
6142  {
6143  // or if the lower right is left of or above the current viewport
6144  // the object is also not drawn
6145  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6146  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6147 
6148  if (!(x < lx || y < ly))
6149  {
6150  result.push_back(pGO);
6151  }
6152  }
6153  }
6154  else
6155  {
6156  // the object has to completly within the box
6157  if (x >= lx && y >= ly)
6158  {
6159  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6160  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6161 
6162  if ((x <= rx && y <= ry))
6163  {
6164  result.push_back(pGO);
6165  }
6166  }
6167  }
6168  }
6169 
6170  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfReactionGlyphs().size();
6171 
6172  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6173  {
6174  pRG = this->mpLayout->getListOfReactionGlyphs()[i];
6175  assert(pRG != NULL);
6176 
6177  // we have to look at all points of the curve if there is one
6178  if (pRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6179  {
6180 
6181  bool drawn = CLLayoutRenderer::is_curve_visible(pRG->getCurve(), lx, ly, rx, ry, partial);
6182 
6183  if (drawn)
6184  {
6185  result.push_back(pRG);
6186  }
6187  }
6188  else
6189  {
6190  pBB = &pRG->getBoundingBox();
6191  x = pBB->getPosition().getX();
6192  y = pBB->getPosition().getY();
6193 
6194  if (partial)
6195  {
6196  // if the upper left is right of or below the current viewport, the
6197  // object is not drawn
6198  if (!(x > rx || y > ry))
6199  {
6200  // or if the lower right is left of or above the current viewport
6201  // the object is also not drawn
6202  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6203  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6204 
6205  if (!(x < lx || y < ly))
6206  {
6207  result.push_back(pRG);
6208  }
6209  }
6210  }
6211  else
6212  {
6213  // the object has to completly within the box
6214  if (x >= lx && y >= ly)
6215  {
6216  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6217  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6218 
6219  if ((x <= rx && y <= ry))
6220  {
6221  result.push_back(pGO);
6222  }
6223  }
6224  }
6225  }
6226 
6227  jMax = pRG->getListOfMetabReferenceGlyphs().size();
6228 
6229  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
6230  {
6231  pSRG = pRG->getListOfMetabReferenceGlyphs()[j];
6232  assert(pSRG != NULL);
6233 
6234  // we have to look at all points of the curve if there is one
6235  if (pSRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6236  {
6237  bool drawn = CLLayoutRenderer::is_curve_visible(pSRG->getCurve(), lx, ly, rx, ry, partial);
6238 
6239  if (drawn)
6240  {
6241  result.push_back(pSRG);
6242  }
6243  }
6244  else
6245  {
6246  pBB = &pSRG->getBoundingBox();
6247  x = pBB->getPosition().getX();
6248  y = pBB->getPosition().getY();
6249 
6250  if (partial)
6251  {
6252  // if the upper left is right of or below the current viewport, the
6253  // object is not drawn
6254  if (!(x > rx || y > ry))
6255  {
6256  // or if the lower right is left of or above the current viewport
6257  // the object is also not drawn
6258  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6259  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6260 
6261  if (!(x < lx || y < ly))
6262  {
6263  result.push_back(pSRG);
6264  }
6265  }
6266  }
6267  else
6268  {
6269  // the object has to completly within the box
6270  if (x >= lx && y >= ly)
6271  {
6272  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6273  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6274 
6275  if ((x <= rx && y <= ry))
6276  {
6277  result.push_back(pGO);
6278  }
6279  }
6280  }
6281  }
6282  }
6283  }
6284 
6285  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfTextGlyphs().size();
6286 
6287  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6288  {
6289  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfTextGlyphs()[i];
6290  pBB = &pGO->getBoundingBox();
6291  x = pBB->getPosition().getX();
6292  y = pBB->getPosition().getY();
6293 
6294  // if the upper left is right of or below the current viewport, the
6295  // object is not drawn
6296  if (partial)
6297  {
6298  if (!(x > rx || y > ry))
6299  {
6300  // or if the lower right is left of or above the current viewport
6301  // the object is also not drawn
6302  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6303  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6304 
6305  if (!(x < lx || y < ly))
6306  {
6307  result.push_back(pGO);
6308  }
6309  }
6310  }
6311  else
6312  {
6313  // the object has to completly within the box
6314  if (x >= lx && y >= ly)
6315  {
6316  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6317  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6318 
6319  if ((x <= rx && y <= ry))
6320  {
6321  result.push_back(pGO);
6322  }
6323  }
6324  }
6325  }
6326 
6327  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfGeneralGlyphs().size();
6328 
6329  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6330  {
6331  CLGeneralGlyph* pGG = this->mpLayout->getListOfGeneralGlyphs()[i];
6332  assert(pGG != NULL);
6333 
6334  // we have to look at all points of the curve if there is one
6335  if (pGG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6336  {
6337 
6338  bool drawn = CLLayoutRenderer::is_curve_visible(pGG->getCurve(), lx, ly, rx, ry, partial);
6339 
6340  if (drawn)
6341  {
6342  result.push_back(pGG);
6343  }
6344  }
6345  else
6346  {
6347  pBB = &pGG->getBoundingBox();
6348  x = pBB->getPosition().getX();
6349  y = pBB->getPosition().getY();
6350 
6351  if (partial)
6352  {
6353  // if the upper left is right of or below the current viewport, the
6354  // object is not drawn
6355  if (!(x > rx || y > ry))
6356  {
6357  // or if the lower right is left of or above the current viewport
6358  // the object is also not drawn
6359  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6360  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6361 
6362  if (!(x < lx || y < ly))
6363  {
6364  result.push_back(pGG);
6365  }
6366  }
6367  }
6368  else
6369  {
6370  // the object has to completly within the box
6371  if (x >= lx && y >= ly)
6372  {
6373  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6374  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6375 
6376  if ((x <= rx && y <= ry))
6377  {
6378  result.push_back(pGO);
6379  }
6380  }
6381  }
6382  }
6383 
6384  jMax = pGG->getListOfSubglyphs().size();
6385 
6386  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
6387  {
6388  CLGraphicalObject *pSubglyph = pGG->getListOfSubglyphs()[j];
6389  pBB = &pSubglyph->getBoundingBox();
6390  x = pBB->getPosition().getX();
6391  y = pBB->getPosition().getY();
6392 
6393  if (partial)
6394  {
6395  // if the upper left is right of or below the current viewport, the
6396  // object is not drawn
6397  if (!(x > rx || y > ry))
6398  {
6399  // or if the lower right is left of or above the current viewport
6400  // the object is also not drawn
6401  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6402  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6403 
6404  if (!(x < lx || y < ly))
6405  {
6406  result.push_back(pSubglyph);
6407  }
6408  }
6409  }
6410  else
6411  {
6412  // the object has to completly within the box
6413  if (x >= lx && y >= ly)
6414  {
6415  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6416  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6417 
6418  if ((x <= rx && y <= ry))
6419  {
6420  result.push_back(pSubglyph);
6421  }
6422  }
6423  }
6424  }
6425 
6426  jMax = pGG->getListOfReferenceGlyphs().size();
6427 
6428  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
6429  {
6430  CLReferenceGlyph* pRefG = pGG->getListOfReferenceGlyphs()[j];
6431  assert(pRefG != NULL);
6432 
6433  // we have to look at all points of the curve if there is one
6434  if (pRefG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6435  {
6436  bool drawn = CLLayoutRenderer::is_curve_visible(pRefG->getCurve(), lx, ly, rx, ry, partial);
6437 
6438  if (drawn)
6439  {
6440  result.push_back(pRefG);
6441  }
6442  }
6443  else
6444  {
6445  pBB = &pRefG->getBoundingBox();
6446  x = pBB->getPosition().getX();
6447  y = pBB->getPosition().getY();
6448 
6449  if (partial)
6450  {
6451  // if the upper left is right of or below the current viewport, the
6452  // object is not drawn
6453  if (!(x > rx || y > ry))
6454  {
6455  // or if the lower right is left of or above the current viewport
6456  // the object is also not drawn
6457  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6458  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6459 
6460  if (!(x < lx || y < ly))
6461  {
6462  result.push_back(pRefG);
6463  }
6464  }
6465  }
6466  else
6467  {
6468  // the object has to completly within the box
6469  if (x >= lx && y >= ly)
6470  {
6471  x += pBB->getDimensions().getWidth();
6472  y += pBB->getDimensions().getHeight();
6473 
6474  if ((x <= rx && y <= ry))
6475  {
6476  result.push_back(pGO);
6477  }
6478  }
6479  }
6480  }
6481  }
6482  }
6483  }
6484 
6485  return result;
6486 }
6487 
6488 /**
6489  * Sets the current selection box.
6490  * Setting the Box to NULL means that no selection box is drawn.
6491  */
6492 void CLLayoutRenderer::setSelectionBox(const CLBoundingBox* pBox)
6493 {
6494  if (this->mpSelectionBox != NULL)
6495  {
6496  delete this->mpSelectionBox;
6497  }
6498 
6499  if (pBox == NULL)
6500  {
6501  this->mpSelectionBox = NULL;
6502  }
6503  else
6504  {
6505  this->mpSelectionBox = new CLBoundingBox(*pBox);
6506  }
6507 }
6508 
6509 /**
6510  * returns a point to the current selection box.
6511  */
6512 CLBoundingBox* CLLayoutRenderer::getSelectionBox()
6513 {
6514  return this->mpSelectionBox;
6515 }
6516 
6517 /**
6518  * returns a const point to the current selection box.
6519  */
6520 const CLBoundingBox* CLLayoutRenderer::getSelectionBox() const
6521 {
6522  return this->mpSelectionBox;
6523 }
6524 
6525 /**
6526  * draws the selection box if there is one
6527  */
6528 void CLLayoutRenderer::draw_selection_box() const
6529 {
6530  if (this->mpSelectionBox != NULL)
6531  {
6532  // draw four semi transparent rectangles around the
6533  // bounding box
6534  double width = this->mW / this->mZoomFactor;
6535  double height = this->mH / this->mZoomFactor;
6536  double lx = this->mpSelectionBox->getPosition().getX();
6537  double ly = this->mpSelectionBox->getPosition().getY();
6538  double rx = lx + this->mpSelectionBox->getDimensions().getWidth();
6539  double ry = ly + this->mpSelectionBox->getDimensions().getHeight();
6540  glColor4f(0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5);
6541  // top
6542  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
6543  glVertex3d(this->mX, this->mY, 0.1);
6544  glVertex3d(this->mX + width, this->mY, 0.1);
6545  glVertex3d(this->mX + width, ly, 0.1);
6546  glVertex3d(this->mX, ly, 0.1);
6547  glEnd();
6548  // bottom
6549  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
6550  glVertex3d(this->mX, ry, 0.1);
6551  glVertex3d(this->mX + width, ry, 0.1);
6552  glVertex3d(this->mX + width, this->mY + height, 0.1);
6553  glVertex3d(this->mX, this->mY + height, 0.1);
6554  glEnd();
6555  // left
6556  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
6557  glVertex3d(this->mX, ly, 0.1);
6558  glVertex3d(lx, ly, 0.1);
6559  glVertex3d(lx, ry, 0.1);
6560  glVertex3d(this->mX, ry, 0.1);
6561  glEnd();
6562  // right
6563  glBegin(GL_POLYGON);
6564  glVertex3d(rx, ly, 0.1);
6565  glVertex3d(this->mX + width, ly, 0.1);
6566  glVertex3d(this->mX + width, ry, 0.1);
6567  glVertex3d(rx, ry, 0.1);
6568  glEnd();
6569  }
6570 }
6571 
6572 /**
6573  * converts the given coordinates from viewport space into model space.
6574  */
6575 std::pair<double, double> CLLayoutRenderer::convert_to_model_space(double x, double y) const
6576 {
6577  double modelX = this->mX + (double)x / this->mZoomFactor;
6578  double modelY = this->mY + (double)y / this->mZoomFactor;
6579  return std::pair<double, double>(modelX, modelY);
6580 }
6581 
6582 /**
6583  * Updates the associations of species reference glyphs
6584  * and text glyphs.
6585  */
6586 void CLLayoutRenderer::update_associations()
6587 {
6588  mTextGlyphToGraphicalObjectMap.clear();
6589  mTextGlyphToGraphicalObjectMap.clear();
6590  // maps that store the associations for species reference glyphs
6591  mSpeciesReferenceToSpeciesMap.clear();
6592  mSpeciesToSpeciesReferenceMap.clear();
6593  mSpeciesReferenceToReactionMap.clear();
6594  mReactionToSpeciesReferenceMap.clear();
6595 
6596  std::map<std::string, CLGraphicalObject*> idMap;
6597 
6598  if (this->mpLayout)
6599  {
6600  // first we have to create a map that specifies for each speciesreference with an id
6601  // whether it is a modifier or not
6602  size_t j, jMax;
6603  size_t i, iMax = this->mpModel->getReactions().size();
6604  const CReaction* pReaction = NULL;
6605  std::map<std::string, bool> modifierMap;
6606 
6607  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6608  {
6609  pReaction = this->mpModel->getReactions()[i];
6610  jMax = pReaction->getChemEq().getSubstrates().size();
6611 
6612  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
6613  {
6614  modifierMap[pReaction->getChemEq().getSubstrates()[j]->getKey()] = false;
6615  }
6616 
6617  jMax = pReaction->getChemEq().getProducts().size();
6618 
6619  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
6620  {
6621  modifierMap[pReaction->getChemEq().getProducts()[j]->getKey()] = false;
6622  }
6623 
6624  jMax = pReaction->getChemEq().getModifiers().size();
6625 
6626  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
6627  {
6628  modifierMap[pReaction->getChemEq().getModifiers()[j]->getKey()] = true;
6629  }
6630  }
6631 
6632  // remove the empty string again in case a species reference did not have an id
6633  std::map<std::string, bool>::iterator pos = modifierMap.find("");
6634 
6635  if (pos != modifierMap.end())
6636  {
6637  modifierMap.erase(pos);
6638  }
6639 
6640  CLGraphicalObject* pGO = NULL;
6641  CLReactionGlyph* pRG = NULL;
6642  CLMetabReferenceGlyph* pSRG = NULL;
6643  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfCompartmentGlyphs().size();
6644 
6645  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6646  {
6647  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfCompartmentGlyphs()[i];
6648  idMap[pGO->getKey()] = pGO;
6649  }
6650 
6651  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfMetaboliteGlyphs().size();
6652 
6653  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6654  {
6655  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfMetaboliteGlyphs()[i];
6656  idMap[pGO->getKey()] = pGO;
6657  }
6658 
6659  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfReactionGlyphs().size();
6660 
6661  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6662  {
6663  pRG = this->mpLayout->getListOfReactionGlyphs()[i];
6664  idMap[pRG->getKey()] = pRG;
6665  this->mReactionToSpeciesReferenceMap[pRG] = std::set<std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool> >();
6666  jMax = pRG->getListOfMetabReferenceGlyphs().size();
6667 
6668  for (j = 0; j < jMax; ++j)
6669  {
6670  pSRG = pRG->getListOfMetabReferenceGlyphs()[j];
6671  assert(pSRG != NULL);
6672  idMap[pSRG->getKey()] = pSRG;
6673  bool modifier = false;
6674 
6675  if (!pSRG->getMetabGlyphKey().empty())
6676  {
6677  // we have to find out if this species reference represents a modifier or not
6678  if (!pSRG->getModelObjectKey().empty())
6679  {
6680  if (modifierMap.find(pSRG->getModelObjectKey()) != modifierMap.end())
6681  {
6682  modifier = modifierMap[pSRG->getModelObjectKey()];
6683  }
6684  }
6685 
6686  this->mReactionToSpeciesReferenceMap[pRG].insert(std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool>(pSRG, modifier));
6687  std::map<std::string, CLGraphicalObject*>::iterator pos = idMap.find(pSRG->getMetabGlyphKey());
6688 
6689  if (pos != idMap.end())
6690  {
6691  CLMetabGlyph* pSG = dynamic_cast<CLMetabGlyph*>(pos->second);
6692  assert(pSG != NULL);
6693  this->mSpeciesReferenceToSpeciesMap[pSRG] = std::pair<CLMetabGlyph*, bool>(pSG, modifier);
6694  std::map<CLMetabGlyph*, std::set<std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool> > >::iterator pos2 = this->mSpeciesToSpeciesReferenceMap.find(pSG);
6695 
6696  if (pos2 == this->mSpeciesToSpeciesReferenceMap.end())
6697  {
6698  this->mSpeciesToSpeciesReferenceMap[pSG] = std::set<std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool> >();
6699  }
6700 
6701  this->mSpeciesToSpeciesReferenceMap[pSG].insert(std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool>(pSRG, modifier));
6702  }
6703  else
6704  {
6705  std::cerr << "Error. species glyph with id \"" << pSRG->getMetabGlyphKey() << "\" referenced in species reference glyph \"" << pSRG->getKey() << "\", but no species glyph with that id exists." << std::endl;
6706  }
6707  }
6708  else
6709  {
6710  // now we check if one end of the species reference curve is on top of one endpoint of the reaction
6711  // if not, we assume it is a modifier
6712  // if yes, we check which end it is that hits the reaction and set the modifier flag accordingly
6713  if (pSRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0 && pRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6714  {
6715  const CLPoint* pSRGFirstPoint = &pSRG->getCurve().getSegmentAt(0)->getStart();
6716  const CLPoint* pSRGLastPoint = &pSRG->getCurve().getSegmentAt(pSRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() - 1)->getEnd();
6717  const CLPoint* pRGFirstPoint = &pRG->getCurve().getSegmentAt(0)->getStart();
6718  const CLPoint* pRGLastPoint = &pRG->getCurve().getSegmentAt(pRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() - 1)->getEnd();
6719 
6720  if (distance(*pSRGFirstPoint, *pRGFirstPoint) < 1e-9)
6721  {
6722  // it probably is a substrate
6723  modifier = false;
6724  }
6725  else if (distance(*pSRGFirstPoint, *pRGLastPoint) < 1e-9)
6726  {
6727  // it probably is a product
6728  modifier = false;
6729  }
6730  else if (distance(*pSRGLastPoint, *pRGFirstPoint) < 1e-9)
6731  {
6732  // it probably is a substrate pointing the wrong direction
6733  modifier = true;
6734  }
6735  else if (distance(*pSRGLastPoint, *pRGLastPoint) < 1e-9)
6736  {
6737  // it probably is a product pointing the wrong direction
6738  modifier = true;
6739  }
6740  else
6741  {
6742  // it probably is a modifier, but we still don't know whether it is pointing in the right direction
6743  // for now we just assume it is
6744  modifier = true;
6745  }
6746  }
6747 
6748  this->mReactionToSpeciesReferenceMap[pRG].insert(std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool>(pSRG, modifier));
6749  }
6750 
6751  this->mSpeciesReferenceToReactionMap[pSRG] = std::pair<CLReactionGlyph*, bool>(pRG, modifier);
6752  }
6753  }
6754 
6755  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfGeneralGlyphs().size();
6756 
6757  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6758  {
6759  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfGeneralGlyphs()[i];
6760  idMap[pGO->getKey()] = pGO;
6761  }
6762 
6763  iMax = this->mpLayout->getListOfTextGlyphs().size();
6764 
6765  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6766  {
6767  pGO = this->mpLayout->getListOfTextGlyphs()[i];
6768  idMap[pGO->getKey()] = pGO;
6769  }
6770 
6771  CLTextGlyph* pTG = NULL;
6772 
6773  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6774  {
6775  pTG = this->mpLayout->getListOfTextGlyphs()[i];
6776 
6777  if (!pTG->getGraphicalObjectKey().empty())
6778  {
6779  if (pTG->getGraphicalObjectKey() == pTG->getKey())
6780  {
6781  std::cerr << "Error. CLText* glyph \"" << pTG->getKey() << "\" is referencing itself." << std::endl;
6782  }
6783 
6784  std::map<std::string, CLGraphicalObject*>::iterator pos = idMap.find(pTG->getGraphicalObjectKey());
6785 
6786  if (pos != idMap.end())
6787  {
6788  mTextGlyphToGraphicalObjectMap[pTG] = pos->second;
6789 
6790  if (this->mGraphicalObjectToTextGlyphMap.find(pos->second) == this->mGraphicalObjectToTextGlyphMap.end())
6791  {
6792  this->mGraphicalObjectToTextGlyphMap[pos->second] = std::set<CLTextGlyph*>();
6793  }
6794 
6795  this->mGraphicalObjectToTextGlyphMap[pos->second].insert(pTG);
6796  }
6797  else
6798  {
6799  std::cerr << "Error. Layout object with id \"" << pTG->getGraphicalObjectKey() << "\" referenced from text glyph does not exist." << std::endl;
6800  }
6801  }
6802  }
6803  }
6804 }
6805 
6806 /**
6807  * Moves a given graphical object by a given vector.
6808  */
6809 void CLLayoutRenderer::move_graphical_object(CLGraphicalObject* pObject, double dx, double dy)
6810 {
6811  pObject->getBoundingBox().getPosition().setX(pObject->getBoundingBox().getPosition().getX() + dx);
6812  pObject->getBoundingBox().getPosition().setY(pObject->getBoundingBox().getPosition().getY() + dy);
6813 }
6814 
6815 /**
6816  * Moves a given curve object by a given vector.
6817  * Optionally the method can leave the start and/or the
6818  * endpoint of the curve where it is.
6819  */
6820 void CLLayoutRenderer::move_curve_object(CLCurve* pCurve, double dx, double dy, bool leaveStartPoint, bool leaveEndpoint)
6821 {
6822  size_t i, iMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
6823  CLLineSegment* pLS = NULL;
6824 
6825  for (i = 0; i < iMax; ++i)
6826  {
6827  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(i);
6828 
6829  if (i != 0 || (i == 0 && !leaveStartPoint))
6830  {
6831  pLS->getStart().setX(pLS->getStart().getX() + dx);
6832  pLS->getStart().setY(pLS->getStart().getY() + dy);
6833  }
6834 
6835  if (i != iMax || (i == iMax - 1 && !leaveEndpoint))
6836  {
6837  pLS->getEnd().setX(pLS->getEnd().getX() + dx);
6838  pLS->getEnd().setY(pLS->getEnd().getY() + dy);
6839  }
6840 
6841  if (pLS->isBezier())
6842  {
6843  pLS->getBase1().setX(pLS->getBase1().getX() + dx);
6844  pLS->getBase1().setY(pLS->getBase1().getY() + dy);
6845  pLS->getBase2().setX(pLS->getBase2().getX() + dx);
6846  pLS->getBase2().setY(pLS->getBase2().getY() + dy);
6847  }
6848  }
6849 }
6850 
6851 /**
6852  * Moves the given Species glyph by the given vector.
6853  * The endpoints of all associated species reference glyphs are moved as well
6854  * if they are represented by curves.
6855  * Also all associated text glyphs are moved.
6856  */
6857 void CLLayoutRenderer::move_species_glyph(CLMetabGlyph* pSG, double dx, double dy, bool moveSelectedAssociations)
6858 {
6859  move_graphical_object(pSG, dx, dy);
6860  std::set<std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool> >& specrefs = this->mSpeciesToSpeciesReferenceMap[pSG];
6861  std::set<std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool> >::iterator it = specrefs.begin(), endit = specrefs.end();
6862 
6863  while (it != endit)
6864  {
6865  if (moveSelectedAssociations == true || this->mSelection.find(it->first) == this->mSelection.end())
6866  {
6867  if (it->first->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6868  {
6869  if (it->second == false)
6870  {
6871  CLLineSegment* pLS = it->first->getCurve().getSegmentAt(it->first->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() - 1);
6872  assert(pLS != NULL);
6873  pLS->getEnd().setX(pLS->getEnd().getX() + dx);
6874  pLS->getEnd().setY(pLS->getEnd().getY() + dy);
6875  }
6876  else
6877  {
6878  CLLineSegment* pLS = it->first->getCurve().getSegmentAt(0);
6879  assert(pLS != NULL);
6880  pLS->getStart().setX(pLS->getStart().getX() + dx);
6881  pLS->getStart().setY(pLS->getStart().getY() + dy);
6882  }
6883  }
6884  }
6885 
6886  ++it;
6887  }
6888 
6889  std::set<CLTextGlyph*>& tgs = this->mGraphicalObjectToTextGlyphMap[pSG];
6890  std::set<CLTextGlyph*>::iterator it2 = tgs.begin(), endit2 = tgs.end();
6891 
6892  while (it2 != endit2)
6893  {
6894  if (moveSelectedAssociations == true || this->mSelection.find(*it2) == this->mSelection.end())
6895  {
6896  move_graphical_object(*it2, dx, dy);
6897  }
6898 
6899  ++it2;
6900  }
6901 }
6902 
6903 /**
6904  * Moves the given reaction glyph by the given vector.
6905  * The startpoints of all associated species reference glyphs are moved as well
6906  * if they are represented by curves otherwise the comple species reference glyph
6907  * is moved.
6908  * Also all associated text glyphs are moved.
6909  */
6910 void CLLayoutRenderer::move_reaction_glyph(CLReactionGlyph* pRG, double dx, double dy, bool moveSelectedAssociations)
6911 {
6912  if (pRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6913  {
6914  move_curve_object(&pRG->getCurve(), dx, dy);
6915  }
6916  else
6917  {
6918  move_graphical_object(pRG, dx, dy);
6919  }
6920 
6921  std::set<std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool> >& specrefs = this->mReactionToSpeciesReferenceMap[pRG];
6922  std::set<std::pair<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*, bool> >::iterator it = specrefs.begin(), endit = specrefs.end();
6923 
6924  while (it != endit)
6925  {
6926  if (moveSelectedAssociations == true || this->mSelection.find(it->first) == this->mSelection.end())
6927  {
6928  if (it->first->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6929  {
6930  if (it->second == false)
6931  {
6932  CLLineSegment* pLS = it->first->getCurve().getSegmentAt(0);
6933  assert(pLS != NULL);
6934  pLS->getStart().setX(pLS->getStart().getX() + dx);
6935  pLS->getStart().setY(pLS->getStart().getY() + dy);
6936  }
6937  else
6938  {
6939  CLLineSegment* pLS = it->first->getCurve().getSegmentAt(it->first->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() - 1);
6940  assert(pLS != NULL);
6941  pLS->getEnd().setX(pLS->getEnd().getX() + dx);
6942  pLS->getEnd().setY(pLS->getEnd().getY() + dy);
6943  }
6944  }
6945  else
6946  {
6947  move_graphical_object(it->first, dx, dy);
6948  }
6949  }
6950 
6951  ++it;
6952  }
6953 
6954  std::set<CLTextGlyph*>& tgs = this->mGraphicalObjectToTextGlyphMap[pRG];
6955  std::set<CLTextGlyph*>::iterator it2 = tgs.begin(), endit2 = tgs.end();
6956 
6957  while (it2 != endit2)
6958  {
6959  if (moveSelectedAssociations == true || this->mSelection.find(*it2) == this->mSelection.end())
6960  {
6961  move_graphical_object(*it2, dx, dy);
6962  }
6963 
6964  ++it2;
6965  }
6966 }
6967 
6968 /**
6969  * Moves the given text glyph by the given vector.
6970  * For now, we do not move any associated object becuase it is difficult to
6971  * create a behaviour that makes sense. E.g. if the associated object is a species
6972  * glyph, all species reference glyphs might have to be moved.
6973  * So for now, it is easier to only move the text and if the user wants to move the text
6974  * with the associated object, he/she needs to move the object instead.
6975  */
6976 void CLLayoutRenderer::move_text_glyph(CLTextGlyph* pTG, double dx, double dy)
6977 {
6978  move_graphical_object(pTG, dx, dy);
6979 }
6980 
6981 /**
6982  * Moves the species reference glyph.
6983  * If the glpyh is represented by a curve,
6984  * the curves start and endpoint are left as they are.
6985  */
6986 void CLLayoutRenderer::move_species_reference_glyph(CLMetabReferenceGlyph* pSRG, double dx, double dy)
6987 {
6988  if (pSRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
6989  {
6990  move_curve_object(&pSRG->getCurve(), dx, dy, true, true);
6991  }
6992  else
6993  {
6994  move_graphical_object(pSRG, dx, dy);
6995  }
6996 }
6997 
6998 /**
6999  * Moves the current selection.
7000  * If the moveAssociations falg is set to true,
7001  * associated objects that are not selected are
7002  * moved as well.
7003  * In the case of associated species reference glyphs
7004  * this means that the start and/or endpoint is moved.
7005  */
7006 void CLLayoutRenderer::move_selection(double dx, double dy, bool moveAssociated)
7007 {
7008  std::set<CLGraphicalObject*>::iterator it = this->mSelection.begin(), endit = this->mSelection.end();
7009  CLMetabGlyph* pSG = NULL;
7010  CLReactionGlyph* pRG = NULL;
7011  CLTextGlyph* pTG = NULL;
7012  CLMetabReferenceGlyph* pSRG = NULL;
7013 
7014  while (it != endit)
7015  {
7016  pSG = dynamic_cast<CLMetabGlyph*>(*it);
7017 
7018  if (pSG != NULL)
7019  {
7020  if (moveAssociated == true)
7021  {
7022  move_species_glyph(pSG, dx, dy, false);
7023  }
7024  else
7025  {
7026  move_graphical_object(*it, dx, dy);
7027  }
7028  }
7029  else
7030  {
7031  pTG = dynamic_cast<CLTextGlyph*>(*it);
7032 
7033  if (pTG != NULL)
7034  {
7035  if (moveAssociated == true)
7036  {
7037  move_text_glyph(pTG, dx, dy);
7038  }
7039  else
7040  {
7041  move_graphical_object(*it, dx, dy);
7042  }
7043  }
7044  else
7045  {
7046  pSRG = dynamic_cast<CLMetabReferenceGlyph*>(*it);
7047 
7048  if (pSRG != NULL)
7049  {
7050  if (moveAssociated == true)
7051  {
7052  move_species_reference_glyph(pSRG, dx, dy);
7053  }
7054  else
7055  {
7056  if (pSRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
7057  {
7058  move_curve_object(&pSRG->getCurve(), dx, dy, false, false);
7059  }
7060  else
7061  {
7062  move_graphical_object(*it, dx, dy);
7063  }
7064  }
7065  }
7066  else
7067  {
7068  pRG = dynamic_cast<CLReactionGlyph*>(*it);
7069 
7070  if (pRG != NULL)
7071  {
7072  if (moveAssociated == true)
7073  {
7074  move_reaction_glyph(pRG, dx, dy, false);
7075  }
7076  else
7077  {
7078  if (pRG->getCurve().getNumCurveSegments() != 0)
7079  {
7080  move_curve_object(&pRG->getCurve(), dx, dx, false, false);
7081  }
7082  else
7083  {
7084  move_graphical_object(*it, dx, dy);
7085  }
7086  }
7087  }
7088  else
7089  {
7090  move_graphical_object(*it, dx, dy);
7091  }
7092  }
7093  }
7094  }
7095 
7096  ++it;
7097  }
7098 }
7099 
7100 /**
7101  * reverts the direction of the given curve.
7102  * The result is returned as a new curve object and
7103  * the caller has to make sure that the memory for the
7104  * new curve is freed.
7105  */
7106 CLCurve* CLLayoutRenderer::revert_curve(const CLCurve* pCurve)
7107 {
7108  CLCurve* pC = new CLCurve();
7109  size_t i, iMax = pCurve->getNumCurveSegments();
7110  const CLLineSegment* pLS = NULL;
7111  CLLineSegment* pNewLS = NULL;
7112 
7113  for (i = iMax; i > 0; --i)
7114  {
7115  pLS = pCurve->getSegmentAt(i - 1);
7116  pNewLS = new CLLineSegment(pLS->getEnd(), pLS->getStart());
7117 
7118  if (pLS->isBezier())
7119  {
7120  // revert the two basepoints
7121  pNewLS->setBase1(pLS->getBase2());
7122  pNewLS->setBase2(pLS->getBase1());
7123  pNewLS->setIsBezier(true);
7124  }
7125 
7126  pC->addCurveSegment(pNewLS);
7127  delete pNewLS;
7128  }
7129 
7130  return pC;
7131 }
7132 
7133 /**
7134  * calculates the distance between two layout points.
7135  */
7136 double CLLayoutRenderer::distance(const CLPoint& p1, const CLPoint& p2)
7137 {
7138  return sqrt(pow(p1.getX() - p2.getX(), 2) + pow(p1.getY() - p2.getY(), 2));
7139 }
7140

7144 double CLLayoutRenderer::getAspect() const
7145 {
7146  return this->mAspect;
7147 }

7152 void CLLayoutRenderer::setAspect(double aspect)

7154  this->mAspect = aspect;
7155 }

7256  * Sets the fog density.
7257  */
7258 void CLLayoutRenderer::setFogDensity(GLfloat dens)
7259 {
7260  this->mFogDensity = (dens > 1.0) ? 1.0f : ((dens < 0.0f) ? 0.0f : dens);
7261 }

7270 
7271 /**
7272  * On non apple systems, we need to get the pointers to extension functions.
7273  */
7274 void CLLayoutRenderer::initialize_gl_extension_functions()
7275 {
7276  const char* extensionsString = (const char*)glGetString(GL_EXTENSIONS);
7277 
7278  if (extensionsString == NULL) return;
7279 
7280  // TODO this method of testing if the extension is supported is not very safe, we should check if there is
7281  // a whitespace character or npos after the position
7282  if (std::string(extensionsString).find("GL_EXT_fog_coord") == std::string::npos) return;
7283 
7284 #ifdef _WIN32
7285  mpGlFogCoordfEXT = (void(_stdcall*)(GLfloat)) wglGetProcAddress("glFogCoordfEXT");
7286 #else
7287 #ifdef __APPLE__
7288  mpGlFogCoordfEXT = (void(*)(GLfloat)) MyNSGLGetProcAddress("glFogCoordfEXT");
7289 #else
7290  mpGlFogCoordfEXT = (void(*)(GLfloat)) glXGetProcAddressARB((const GLubyte*)"glFogCoordfEXT");
7291 #endif // __APPLE__
7292 #endif // _WIN32
7293  mGLFunctionsInitialized = true;
7294 }
7295 
7296 #ifdef __APPLE__
7297 #ifndef COPASI_MAC_USE_DEPRECATED_LOOKUP
7298 #include <dlfcn.h>
7299 #endif
7300 void * CLLayoutRenderer::MyNSGLGetProcAddress(const char *name)
7301 {
7302 #ifndef COPASI_MAC_USE_DEPRECATED_LOOKUP
7303  return dlsym(RTLD_DEFAULT, name);
7304 #else
7305  NSSymbol symbol;
7306  char *symbolName;
7307  symbolName = (char*)malloc(strlen(name) + 2);
7308 
7309  strcpy(symbolName + 1, name);
7310 
7311  symbolName[0] = '_';
7312  symbol = NULL;
7313 
7314  // if (NSIsSymbolNameDefined(symbolName))
7315  {
7316  const struct mach_header* header = NSAddImage("/System/Library/Frameworks/OpenGL.framework/Versions/A/OpenGL", NSADDIMAGE_OPTION_RETURN_ON_ERROR);
7317  // we should always find the OpenGL library
7318  assert(header != NULL);
7319  symbol = NSLookupSymbolInImage(header, symbolName, NSLOOKUPSYMBOLINIMAGE_OPTION_BIND | NSLOOKUPSYMBOLINIMAGE_OPTION_RETURN_ON_ERROR);
7320  //symbol = NSLookupAndBindSymbol(symbolName);
7321  }
7322 
7323  free(symbolName);
7324 
7325  return symbol ? NSAddressOfSymbol(symbol) : NULL;
7326 #endif
7327 }
7328 #endif // __APPLE__
